definitions.example: We had a good day's fishing at the weekend.

definitions.definition: The act of catching other forms of seafood, separately or together with fish.
Commercial fishing: the business or industry of catching fish and other seafood for sale.
definitions.example: This is good news for the fishing industry.

definitions.definition: A fishery, a place for catching fish.
To hunt fish or other aquatic animals.
definitions.example: She went to the river to fish for trout.

definitions.definition: To search (a body of water) for something other than fish.
definitions.example: They fished the surrounding lakes for the dead body.

definitions.definition: To use as bait when fishing.
To (attempt to) find or get hold of an object by searching among other objects.
definitions.example: He was fishing for the keys in his pocket.

definitions.definition: (followed by "for" or "around for") To talk to people in an attempt to get them to say something, or seek to obtain something by artifice.
definitions.example: The actors loitered at the door, fishing for compliments.

definitions.definition: Of a batsman, to attempt to hit a ball outside off stump and miss it.
To repair (a spar or mast) by fastening a beam or other long object (often called a fish) over the damaged part (see Noun above).
